meanings.definition: To communicate information or facts to someone.
meanings.sent1: She was tellin her friend about the fun day at the park.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy tellin stories to my little sister before bedtime.
meanings.sent3: He kept tellin jokes during the serious meeting, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the night sky seem to be tellin secrets to each other.
meanings.sent5: The old book on the shelf was tellin tales of adventures long past.

meanings.sent1: The detective was tellin the suspect's true intentions.
meanings.sent2: The magician was tellin his tricks to the audience.
meanings.sent3: The fortune teller was tellin the future with her crystal ball.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins were tellin stories of a forgotten civilization.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious letter was tellin secrets that no one else knew.

meanings.definition: To give an account or narrative of something.
meanings.sent1: The historian was tellin the tale of the great battle.
meanings.sent2: Grandma loves tellin us stories from her childhood.
meanings.sent3: The parrot was tellin a funny story in its own squawky way.
meanings.sent4: The wind in the trees was tellin a story of the changing seasons.
meanings.sent5: The painting on the wall was tellin a story of love and loss.
